steps.title: Really make your friends sweat with these tough-to-answer questions!
steps.content: Really make your friends sweat with these tough-to-answer questions! Don’t go too easy on them—ask questions they’ll really have to think about before answering. You’ll have them drawing up a pros and cons list to answer these tough q’s: Would you rather have to eat a bowl full of crickets or a bowl full of worms? Would you rather go to jail for a year or be homeless for a year? Would you rather hike a huge mountain or run a marathon? Would you rather be stuck on an island alone or with someone who talks incessantly? Would you rather work in a group or work alone? Would you rather read a great book or watch a great movie? Would you rather put a stop to war or end world hunger? Would you rather spend the night in a luxury hotel room or camping surrounded by beautiful scenery? Would you rather get $100 dollars or 100 lottery tickets? Would you rather have the very best clothes or the very best technology? Would you rather give up the internet or your pet? Would you rather make a movie about your most embarrassing moment or publish your diary? Would you rather have one wish granted today or three wishes granted ten years from now? Would you rather lose your keys or your cell phone? Would you rather be a kid your whole life or an adult your whole life? Would you rather explore outer space or the ocean? Would you rather always say everything on your mind or never speak again? Would you rather make a phone call or send a text? Would you rather go to a movie or to dinner alone? steps.title: Get them scratching their heads with these thought-provoking questions.
steps.content: Get them scratching their heads with these thought-provoking questions. Would You Rather is a great way to have fun—but it’s also the perfect game to get people thinking and maybe even to learn a little more about each other! Get even more intimate with your besties—or turn acquaintances into friends—with these deep questions: Would you rather be very famous but poor or unknown but rich? Would you rather be remembered in history books for doing something terrible or be completely forgotten after you die? Would you rather be immortal or live the rest of your life with the knowledge of what really happens after death? Would you rather find out a long-standing conspiracy theory was true or find out a juicy piece of gossip only you knew? Would you rather live in the future or in the past? [2] X Research source Would you rather live in the city or the country? Would you rather speak every language in the world or play every instrument? Would you rather everything you drew became real or be able to read people’s minds? Would you rather spend the rest of your life trapped inside or trapped outside? [3] X Research source Would you rather save all of your money for life, or spend it and live broke? Would you feel worse if no one showed up to your wedding or to your funeral? Would you rather have more time or more money? Would you rather become someone else or stay yourself? Would you rather have many good friends or one very best friend? Would you rather be filthy rich and live 400 years ago or be poor but live today? Would you rather your best friend or your boss fall in love with you? Would you rather end hunger or hatred? Would you rather have a rewind button or a pause button on your life? Would you rather be poor and work at a job you love, or rich and work at a job you hate? Would you rather start a colony on another planet or be the leader of a country on Earth? Would you rather have a photographic memory or an IQ of 200? Would you rather be gossiped about or never talked about at all? Would you rather be a genius everyone thinks is an idiot or an idiot everyone thinks is a genius? Would you rather take a pill a day for nutrients and to feel full, but never eat anything again or eat whatever you want but never really feel full? Would you rather go back to kindergarten with everything you know now or know now everything your future self will learn? Would you rather find true love today or win the lottery next year? Would you rather look strong and be weak or look weak and be strong? Would you rather be forced to live the same day over and over again for a full year, or take 3 years off the end of your life? Would you rather have one wish granted today or 10 wishes granted 20 years from now? Would you rather have a pause or a rewind button in your life? Would you rather stay the age you are physically forever or stay the way you are now financially forever? Would you rather be able to take back anything you say or hear any conversation that is about you? Would you rather have universal respect or unlimited power? Would you rather hear a comforting lie or an uncomfortable truth? Would you rather lose your sight or your memories? Would you rather work the job you have now for a year at double your current rate of pay or have one year off with what you are making now? Would you rather spend a year at war or a year in prison? Would you rather be criticized or be ignored? Would you rather be alone all your life or surrounded by really annoying people? Would you rather have to plan every single moment or live absolutely spontaneously and never plan anything?

steps.title: Kick the heat up a notch with these super tough-to-answer questions.
steps.content: Kick the heat up a notch with these super tough-to-answer questions. These juicy Would You Rather questions aren't for the faint of heart! Put your friends on the spot by making them choose between 2 tough (and potentially embarrassing) options: Would you rather be caught in a compromising position at work or at a family gathering? steps.title: Consider your audience when asking questions.
steps.content: Consider your audience when asking questions. Not every question will be appropriate or understandable in every context. Before you start playing Would You Rather, consider where you are and who you're playing with to make sure you don't ask any questions that might offend or confuse the other players, and if anyone feels uncomfortable answering a certain question, respect their choice and try a safer question. For instance, if you're playing with kids, many of the questions above might not be appropriate. Even if you're only playing with adults, if you're playing in the workplace, for instance, avoid questions that may come off unprofessional or overly explicit, like any sex-related questions. Consider also how well you know the people you're playing with before asking an intimate or saucy question.
